data.title: 100 Best Dutch (Netherlands) Footballers of All Time
data.meta_description: Can you name the 100 Best Dutch (Netherlands) Footballers of All Time? (in no particular order) Test your knowledge on this sports quiz and compare your score to others. Quiz by msahly
data.text:
HintAnswer Introduced Tiki Taka to Barcelona. Considered one of the most influential figures in the history of the sport Legendary striker for Ajax & AC Milan in the '80s & '90s. 3 time Ballon d'Or winner. Captain of the Netherlands Euro'88 winning team. Nicknamed the Black Tulip. Legendary midfielder for AC Milan , PSV , Feyenoord M 1968-1991: Ajax, Barcelona, New York Cosmos, Groningen Legendary Defender/Midfielder for Ajax & AC Milan F 1986-2006: Ajax, Inter, ARSENAL M 2002-2019: Ajax, Real Madrid, Inter, Galatasaray, Nice, Al Gharafa F 1945-1964: Xerxes, Inter, Torino, Valencia, VVV, Levante, Fortuna M 1969-1985: Ajax, Anderlecht, Standard Liege, PSV D 1992-2007: Zwolle, Cambuur, Willem II, Man Utd, Lazio, Milan, Ajax M 2000-2021: Groningen, PSV, Chelsea, Real Madrid, BAYERN MUNICH Scored the winner for Barcelona's first ever European Cup in 1992. Sweeper, deadly free kick taker D 1968-1986: AJAX, Napoli, Cannes M 1971-1987: Scored the winning goal for Ajax in the European Cup final against Juventus in 1973 M 1992-2014: The only player to win the Champions League with 3 different clubs M 1954-1972: Xerxes, FEYENOORD F 1965-1982: DWS, Club Brugge, ANDERLECHT, Toulouse F 1964-1982: PSV ; All time Eredivisie top scorer, All time PSV top goal scorer M 1962-1983: Feyenoord legend. known as De Kromme (The Crooked) M 1965-1982: FEYENOORD, Ajax F 1964-1984: Top scorer in Eredivisie 5 times including 4 in a row from 1974-78 G 1990-2011: Ajax, Juventus, Fulham, Manchester United D 1988-2006: Ajax, Barcelona, Galatasaray, Rangers M 1991-2014: Ajax, Milan, Juventus, Barcelona, Inter, Tottenham D 1993-2010: Feyenoord, Rangers, Arsenal, Barcelona D 1979-1999: Sparta Rotterdam. AJAX F 1993-2012: Den Bosch, Heerenveen, PSV, Man Utd, Real Madrid, Hamburg, Malaga M 1992-2013: Fortuna Sittard, PSV, Barcelona, Bayern Munich, Milan D 2011-Current: Groningen, Celtic, Southampton, LIVERPOOL F 1926-1943: UVV, Ajax ; Eredivisie top scorer 9 times , Ajax's all time top goalscorer G 1975-1994: Utrecht, Nottingham Forest, PSV EINDHOVEN M 1990-2009: Willem II, Ajax, Arsenal, Barcelona, Go Ahead Eagles M 1956-1973: Ajax. Mr Ajax , Record appearance holder for Ajax M 1970-1988: Twente, PSV

HintAnswer M 1970-1989: Twente, PSV, Apollon, Seiko, Helmond F 1994-2008: Ajax, Milan, Barcelona, Newcastle, Valencia, PSV, Lille D 1964-1987: AJAX , Schalke, Metz D 1970-1986: PEC Zwolle, FEYENOORD, Bastia, New York Cosmos, Utrecht M 1980-1996: Utrecht , Ajax, Bayern Munich, PSV G 1963-1978: Won 3 consecutive European Cups with Ajax without conceding a goal in any of the 3 finals GK The original Flying Dutchman , Won with Arsenal their first ever top flight title in 1930-31 F 1979-1994: Ajax, Pisa, Torino, PSV, Bordeaux F 1970-1987: First ever Dutchman to win the European Golden Boot with 34 goals for AZ in 1978-98, 4th top scorer in Eredivisie history D 1965-1979: AJAX, MVV G 1952-1970: Ajax, FEYENOORD D 1962-1982: DWS, FEYENOORD, Excelsior. PEC Zwolle F 1993-2010: Vitesse, Tenerife, Deportivo, Bayern Munich, Feyenoord F 2001-2019: Feyenoord, Arsenal , Man Utd, Fenerbahce M 1961-1974: Ajax M 1988-2008: AZ, PSV, Barcelona, Vitesse D 1967-1979: Breda, FC TWENTE D 1957-1974: RBC, NAC, Sparta, Feyenoord, Gent F 1989-2007: RBC, NAC, Celtic, Nottingham Forest, Vitesse, Benfica, Feyenoord, Fenerbahce F 1990-2008: AZ, Boavista, Leeds, Atletico Madrid, Chelsea, Middlesbrough, Charlton M 1986-2003: AJAX, Lazio, Inter M 1978-1998: GRONINGEN, PSV, Mechelen F 1998-2018: Utrecht, Feyenoord, Liverpool, Fenerbahce M 1923-1940: Feyenoord D 1911-1934: HBS D 1987-2003: Haarlem, Twente, PSV, Rangers G 1985-2006: Sparta Rotterdam, Feyenoord, Chelsea, Stoke City F 1959-1969: AJAX, Feyenoord F 1941-1963: PSV (scored 287 in 328 games) holds the record for most goals scored in a single season in Eredivisie History 43 goals in 1956-57 (Inaugural Eredivisie season) D 1994-2012: Roda, PSV, Blackburn, Ajax M 2007-Current: Feyenoord, PSV, Newcastle, Liverpool, PSG, Roma, Al-Ettifaq D 1981-1995: PSV F 1925-1946: 28 goals in 23 games for Netherlands , 2nd Dutch player to play abroad after joining Metz in France F 2002-2021: PSV, Heerenveen, Ajax, Real Madrid, Milan, Schalke
